snippet: Honda’s announcement of the recall of 515 CR-Vs from 2016 led Senator Bill Nelson of Florida to ask whether any Takata airbag inflaters were safe.
abstract: Recent recalls by Honda and General Motors over faulty Takata airbags in newer models raise questions about scope of problem; more than 19 million cars with faulty airbags have already been recalled; regulators are expanding inquiries into Takata.

byline.original: By DANIELLE IVORY and HIROKO TABUCHI

lead_paragraph: Honda’s announcement of the recall of 515 CR-Vs from 2016 led Senator Bill Nelson of Florida to ask whether any Takata airbag inflaters were safe.

headline.main: Wave of New-Car Recalls Raises Questions for Takata Airbags
headline.print_headline: Wave of New-Car Recalls Raises Questions for Takata Airbags
